page.title: 11STAMFORD GOLF CLUB
page.content: Stamford Golf Club is an 18 hole private members club situated at Oakfield House, Heyheads, Stalybridge, Cheshire. Since its foundation in 1900 the course has seen many changes especially in the way the holes have been laid out over the years. New layouts have been made as a result of building developments both private and council which changed the character of the course. Holes were lost as a result of 'Dig for Victory' during the Second World War leaving only 13 holes until Jubilee Year 1977 when extra land was leased from Stamford Estates to once more give the course 18 holes. Stamford is ringed by hills, Bucton and Harridge to the east and Luzley to the west. To the south looking towards Stalybridge is Hartshead Power Station which is soon to be demolished.
